Widgets¶

  • Generic Widgets

  • Custom Widgets

Generic Widgets¶

The generic widgets job is to handle and display frequently recurring values, like the node parameters or certain buttons.

For example a float will always be displayed with a slider. Additional information like the min/max or the stepsize can be parsed alongside.

class src.ui.widgets.custom_widgets.NodeWidget(node_name, param_name, value, set_value, **kwargs)¶

Standard for all NodeWidgets handling the initialization. Also providing a simplified set function, where only the value has to be given.

Parameters

  • node_name – current node name

  • param_name – adjustable param

  • value – current value

  • set_value – function to call on value change

  • kwargs –

class src.ui.widgets.custom_widgets.NodeSwitch(**kwargs)¶

Switches are the standard representation for bool values.

Parameters

**kwargs – See parent class.

class src.ui.widgets.custom_widgets.NodeSlider(min_value=0, max_value=15, step=1, **kwargs)¶

Slider are the standard representation for int and float values.

Parameters

  • min_value – Left end of slider.

  • max_value (param) – Right end of slider.

  • step (param) – Step size, needs to be int for integer sliders.

  • kwargs – See parent class.

class src.ui.widgets.custom_widgets.NodeColor(**kwargs)¶

Color Wheels from kivy garden are the standard representation for RGB colors.

Parameters

**kwargs – See parent class.

class src.ui.widgets.custom_widgets.NodeDisplay(**kwargs)¶

Text Fields are the standard representation for strings.

Parameters

**kwargs – See parent class.

class src.ui.widgets.custom_widgets.CustomButton(function=<function CustomButton.<lambda>>, start_value_function=None, function_call_back=None, hold_down=False, **kwargs)¶

Custom Button for binary operations with predefined second operators.

Parameters

  • function – Any sort of binary operation.

  • start_value_function – If operand comes from a function.

  • function_call_back – Function to call with result value.

  • hold_down – If on hold down the operation will be triggered repeatedly.

  • kwargs –

class src.ui.widgets.custom_widgets.CustomToggleButton(function, function_on_release=None, text_options=['Play', 'Pause'], **kwargs)¶

A Toggle Button that changes the displayed text.

Parameters

  • function – Function to execute on button press.

  • function_on_release – Second function triggered on “release press”, only if specified.

  • text_options – Text to display for both button states.

  • **kwargs –

Custom Widgets¶

Parts that are only used once or have a low probability that they will be reused, dont have to be written in such a general style.

Class Selection¶

The node class selection handles from which classes we sample. In the frontend you can manipulate, reorder … this pool with the class selection widget.

class src.ui.widgets.class_selection.AutoCompleteTextInput(imagenet_dict, wordnet_dict, add_class_to_pool, **kwargs)¶

Text input field to add new labels to the class pool via enter. Suggestions are stored in the variable suggestions and generated based on the current input and matching patterns in the passed dictionaries.

Parameters

  • imagenet_dict – Char to labels and labels to idx (pygtrie).

  • wordnet_dict – Char to hyponym and hyponym to idx (pygtrie).

  • add_class_to_pool – Function to add a new class to the pool (usage via kv file).

  • **kwargs –

on_text(caller, value)¶

This runs a callback when the text changes. The functions first clears all suggestions and then adds new suggestions based on the input to the suggestions variable.

Parameters

  • caller – The caller of the function. Kivy “bind” internal behavior.

  • value – Current text in the text field.

update_text(caller, value: dict)¶

Update the text and text_origin value.

Parameters

  • caller – The caller of the function. Kivy “bind” internal behavior.

  • value – dict containing the text and the text_origin

class src.ui.widgets.class_selection.ClassSelection(param_name: str, node_name: str, value: List, graph_manager, attributes, **kwargs)¶
Widget for class selection. This widget consist of 4 sub parts:

  • recycle_view_class_pool: a recycle view (RV) showing all class labels currently in the pool

  • drop_down_widget: a text input field to add new classes to the pool via enter, extend by a RV for displaying suggestions

  • delete button: to remove exactly one entry from the pool

  • clear all button: to remove all except one entry from the pool

  • move entry button: to put a class to the top of the class pool. Ordering is important for the class sampler

Parameters

  • param_name – Parameter name.

  • node_name – Node name.

  • value – List of indexes currently in the class pool.

  • graph_manager – Graph Manager.

  • attributes – Observable attributes.

  • **kwargs –

add_class_to_pool(class_label, text_origin=0, index=0)¶

Add a list of classes to the class pool. :param class_label: Either a single class label or a hyponym. :param text_origin: 0 = single class, 1 = hyponym. :param index: Index at which position to add the class. Defaults to the front of the list.

create_class_pools()¶
Initialize the class pool. Currently this information is stored in two locations:

  • self.value (list of class idx currently in the pool)

  • self.class_pool_list_of_dicts (RV data format)

This is due the internal working of the recycle view that requires a list containing a dictionary.

delete_entry(*args)¶

Delete the selected (highlighted) entry from the class pool.

Parameters

caller – The caller of the function. Kivy “bind” internal behavior.

load_dicts()¶
For better runtime speed multiple trees and dictionaries are precomputed, mapping between:

  • imagenet_labels: Char to labels and labels to idx (pygtrie).

  • imagenet_classes: Idx to label (dict).

  • wordnet_labels: Char to hyponym and hyponym to idx (pygtrie).

move_node_to_top(*args)¶

Move the selected node to the the start of the class pool. This is mainly for the class sampler, who works position based. (E.g. star sampling taxed node at position [0] as center).

Parameters

caller – The caller of the function. Kivy “bind” internal behavior.

reset_class_pool(*args)¶

Remove all classes except one, since the samples always need an output. Currently the one class is fixed to mask.

Parameters

caller – The caller of the function. Kivy “bind” internal behavior.

update_observable(*args, **kwargs)¶

Observable node pattern. Triggered when the observed value is changed. Updates the value in both stored locations.

Parameters

**kwargs – Dict containing the parameter name and the updated value.

class src.ui.widgets.class_selection.DropDownWidget(imagenet_dict, wordnet_dict, add_class_to_pool, **kwargs)¶

The DDW consist of a text input field(TIF) and a recycle view(RV). They both observe each other. If new text is added in the TIF, the suggestions will be displayed in the RV. If a item gets selected in the RV it will be set as text in the TIF.

Parameters

  • imagenet_dict – char to labels and labels to idx (pygtrie)

  • wordnet_dict – char to hyponym and hyponym to idx (pygtrie)

  • add_class_to_pool – function to add a new class to the class pool

  • **kwargs –

src.ui.widgets.class_selection.key_to_int(x)¶

When using json keys are interpreted as strings. The functions transforms all keys to int.

Parameters

x – Dictionary with Int keys stored as String

Returns

Input dictionary with Int keys.

BPM Manager¶

This widget handles detecting, setting or adjusting of the BPM. This is the only computation actually done in the frontend, since often the frontend device is physically next to the music.

class src.ui.widgets.bpm_widget.BPMManager(observable_node, graph_manager, **kwargs)¶

The main purpose of the BPMManager is to tell if the current frame lies on a beat. :param observable_node: The BPM node, storing the current bpm value as float. :param graph_manager: Project graph manager. :param **kwargs:

class src.ui.widgets.bpm_widget.GlobalBPMWidget(observable_node, graph_manager, bpm_manager, **kwargs)¶

Schedule the update event 60 times a second. Initialize connection to the bpm_manager. They both work on the same node. The BPMWidget is responsible for displaying the bpm and offering functionality to manipulate it.

Parameters

  • observable_node – Bhe BPM node, storing the current bpm value as float.

  • graph_manager – Project graph manager.

  • bpm_manager – Checking if the frame is on a beat.

  • **kwargs –

auto_detect()¶

Toggles the “detect_bpm” button and call the detect_bpm function every 8 seconds. The interval needs to be at least a long as the Beat Detections needs for enough samples.

detect_bpm(*args)¶

Call the beat detection from the Beat Manager. :param *args: Kivy internal, (contains the caller (Button) of the function)

get_bpm()¶

Function to use at runtime in kv files. Returns: BPM (float)

static get_bpm_from_tap(tap_times: List) → float¶

Compute the BPM based on a list of timestamps. :param tap_times: List of time values.

Returns: The computed bpm value.

tap_detect()¶

Appends the current time to a list o timestamps. Called in hippo7.kv

update(dt)¶

Update is triggered by a scheduled, 60 times a second (see init). It checks if there are enough samples to allow for beat detection and checks if the tapping stopped. :param dt: Delta time.
